## Remarks When you create a SqlDataSourceStatusEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Updated> event and examine the values contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceStatusEventArgs> object. The OnDSUpdatedHandler is called by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceView.OnUpdated%2A> method to perform additional post-processing after an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Update%2A> action is performed by a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control.
